docs.snippet: Starts of Housing Decline As Inflation Stays in Check  Housing starts unexpectedly dropped 4.8 percent in August, to an annualized 1.363 million, as builders began projects at the slowest pace this year.    A report from the Federal Reserve showed...
docs.lead_paragraph: Starts of Housing Decline As Inflation Stays in Check Housing starts unexpectedly dropped 4.8 percent in August, to an annualized 1.363 million, as builders began projects at the slowest pace this year. A report from the Federal Reserve showed that labor shortages have not translated into rising consumer or industrial prices. Both are further evidence of slower growth that will keep inflation in check and give the Fed little reason to raise interest rates. $(Page D3.$)

docs.snippet: The biggest attraction in the history of the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, a place usually associated with symphony, ballet and opera, is a freewheeling, audience-participation comedy about a murder in a beauty parlor. ''Shear Madness,''...
docs.lead_paragraph: The biggest attraction in the history of the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, a place usually associated with symphony, ballet and opera, is a freewheeling, audience-participation comedy about a murder in a beauty parlor. ''Shear Madness,'' which celebrated its 10th anniversary this week, has been seen here by nearly 1.5 million people. It is Washington's longest-running play. In Boston, ''Shear Madness'' has been running almost 18 years, and it has just had its 15th anniversary in Chicago. Most things went as usual at the 10th-anniversary show on Thursday night. A murder was committed offstage: someone killed the concert pianist who lived above the beauty salon. The audience, invited to play whodunit, shouted opinions about the suspects' alibis to the detectives investigating the crime. But after the murder had been solved by vote of the audience and curtain calls had been taken, a brief ceremony was held to mark the 10-year milestone. The actor Dwayne Hickman, who played Dobie Gillis in the television series, came onstage and presented Lucite plaques representing the Charlie Chaplin Comedy Award to the play's co-producers, co-creators and original co-stars, Bruce Jordan and Marilyn Abrams.
docs.abstract: Shear Madness, comedy about murder in a beauty parlor, celebrates its 10th anniversary this week in Washington; it has been running in Boston for almost 18 years, and has just had its 15th anniversary in Chicago; Bruce Jordan and Marilyn Abrams, its producers, are opening in several foreign cities in near future; say they may seek to open in New York City at some point; photo (M)

headline.main: How to Be a Hit? A Whodunit Has the Solution

docs.snippet: AT the tiny Garibaldi-Meucci Museum, at Chestnut and Tompkins Avenues in the Rosebank section of Staten Island, the trustees have steadily upgraded the frame cottage where Giuseppe Garibaldi, the hero of Italian independence, briefly stayed with...
docs.lead_paragraph: AT the tiny Garibaldi-Meucci Museum, at Chestnut and Tompkins Avenues in the Rosebank section of Staten Island, the trustees have steadily upgraded the frame cottage where Giuseppe Garibaldi, the hero of Italian independence, briefly stayed with Antonio Meucci, the inventor of the ''teletrofono.'' But there's only so much you can do with four rooms. The Gothic-style frame cottage was originally built on what is now Ditson Street, between Willow and Lynhurst Avenues, around 1845, probably by Dr. William Townsend, a local landowner and developer. The north shore of Staten Island had seen sustained development as a resort area beginning in the 1820's.
docs.abstract: Garibaldi-Meucci Museum on Staten Island, NY, is housed in cottage where hero of Italian independence briefly stayed with Antonio Meucci, inventor of telephone; photos (M)

headline.main: Streetscapes/The Garibaldi-Meucci Museum in Staten Island; 4-Room Tribute to the Hero of Italian Independence

docs.snippet: The Ford Motor Company said yesterday that it planned to spend up to $1 billion to build a factory in southern Brazil, at the heart of the fast-growing Mercosur free trade area. The new plant will produce 100,000 units of a yet-to-be-identified model...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Ford Motor Company said yesterday that it planned to spend up to $1 billion to build a factory in southern Brazil, at the heart of the fast-growing Mercosur free trade area. The new plant will produce 100,000 units of a yet-to-be-identified model by 2001, Ford said. The investment brings to at least $3 billion the amount Ford plans to spend in Brazil between 1995 and 2000 to improve its lagging market share amid a regional boom in car sales there. The company's immediate goal is to sell up to 30 percent of the plant's output to neighboring Mercosur countries -- Argentina, Uruguay and Paraguay -- and the rest in Brazil. Ford's stock was up $1.1875 at $46.8125.
docs.abstract: Ford Motor Co says it plans to spend up to $1 billion to build factory in southern Brazil (S)

headline.main: FORD SAYS IT PLANS $1 BILLION FACTORY IN BRAZIL

docs.snippet: Swiss Indoors  Kafelnikov Is Upset     With 20 aces and a match-ending net-cord blooper, Mark Philippoussis upset top-seeded Yevgeny Kafelnikov, 6-3, 6-7 (5-7), 6-2, yesterday in the quarterfinals of the $975,000 Swiss Indoors tennis tournament in...
docs.lead_paragraph: Swiss Indoors Kafelnikov Is Upset With 20 aces and a match-ending net-cord blooper, Mark Philippoussis upset top-seeded Yevgeny Kafelnikov, 6-3, 6-7 (5-7), 6-2, yesterday in the quarterfinals of the $975,000 Swiss Indoors tennis tournament in Basel. The loss ended Kafelnikov's bid for a third title this season. Britain's top two players advance to the semifinals, eliminating two Swedes to set up the possibility of the first all-British final in the history of the Association of Tennis Professionals.

docs.snippet: New York steakhouses, temples for the most devout carnivores, stand tall once more but are by no means the only option for meat-worshipers. The following restaurants, representing Asia, South America and the Mediterranean as well as the United...
docs.lead_paragraph: New York steakhouses, temples for the most devout carnivores, stand tall once more but are by no means the only option for meat-worshipers. The following restaurants, representing Asia, South America and the Mediterranean as well as the United States, all offer menus rich enough in meat to satisfy any persuasion. (Here are summaries, written by Eric Asimov, taken from Ruth Reichl's and Mr. Asimov's dining reviews, columns and articles in The Times.) 1. Christos Hasapo-Taverna + (718) 726-5195 41-08 23d Avenue Astoria, Queens $ All major cards
docs.abstract: Summaries of reviews of New York steakhouses and other restaurants featuring meat; map (M)

docs.snippet: INTERNATIONAL   3-15    Two Orthodox Churches Fight for Place in Russia  Russia is undergoing a religious war, pitting the Russian Orthodox Church, the dominant faith in Russia and an ally of the Yeltsin Government, against the small breakaway Free...
docs.lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL 3-15 Two Orthodox Churches Fight for Place in Russia Russia is undergoing a religious war, pitting the Russian Orthodox Church, the dominant faith in Russia and an ally of the Yeltsin Government, against the small breakaway Free Orthodox Church, which describes itself as the true heir of Russia's religious legacy. At issue is control over churches, seminaries and schools. 1 Cuba Toes Communist Line Meeting for the first time in six years, Fidel Castro and the Communist hierarchy rejected China's model of economic liberalization and endorsed policies to maintain the status quo for as long as possible. 10

docs.snippet: An Argentine airliner crashed and exploded in Uruguay, killing all 75 people aboard, the authorities said today. The jet had changed course to try to avoid a fierce rainstorm.    The airliner, a DC-9 operated by the Austral division of Aerolineas...
docs.lead_paragraph: An Argentine airliner crashed and exploded in Uruguay, killing all 75 people aboard, the authorities said today. The jet had changed course to try to avoid a fierce rainstorm. The airliner, a DC-9 operated by the Austral division of Aerolineas Argentinas, crashed about 11 P.M. Friday near Nuevo Berlin, a town in Rio Negro on the banks of the Uruguay River, which separates Argentina from Uruguay.
docs.abstract: Argentine airliner crashes and explodes in Uruguay, killing all 75 people aboard; jet had changed course to try to avoid fierce rainstorm; airliner was DC-9 operted by division of Aerolineas Argentinas; map (M)

headline.main: 75 Die in Crash of Argentine Plane in Uruguay

docs.snippet: WORLD CUP     The names of the eight European nations that finished second in their qualifying groups were put into a hat and drawn in four pairs yesterday at FIFA's headquarters in Zurich. The four pairs will play a two-game series for the four...
docs.lead_paragraph: WORLD CUP The names of the eight European nations that finished second in their qualifying groups were put into a hat and drawn in four pairs yesterday at FIFA's headquarters in Zurich. The four pairs will play a two-game series for the four remaining spots allocated to Europe for the tournament in France next summer.
